metadata.Title: CVE-2022-31085 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
LDAP Account Manager (LAM) is a webfrontend for managing entries (e.g.users, groups, DHCP settings) stored in an LDAP directory. In versionsprior to 8.0 the session files include the LDAP user name and password inclear text if the PHP OpenSSL extension is not installed or encryption isdisabled by configuration. This issue has been fixed in version 8.0. Usersunable to upgrade should install the PHP OpenSSL extension and make suresession encryption is enabled in LAM main configuration.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldap-account-manager - 8.0.1-1
ldap-account-manager-lamdaemon - 8.0.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ldap-account-manager package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.1-1').
